greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest proper prime power divisor of n, or 1 if n is squarefree.
comment: These values were mistakenly entered into A203025.
link: Franklin T. Adams-Watters, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: 20 = 2^2 * 5, so 2^2 = 4 is the only proper prime power divisor of 20, thus a(20) = 4.
mathematica: Table[s = Select[FactorInteger[n], #[[2]] > 1 &]; If[s == {}, 1, Max[#1^#2 & @@@ s]], {n, 100}] (* _T. D. Noe_, Jan 02 2012 *)
results.author: _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jun 06 2016
